name: Audio Device In CHOP
description: The Audio Device In CHOP receives audio from any of the attached audio input devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. It always outputs time sliced audio data.
summary: The Audio Device In CHOP receives audio from any of the attached audio input devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. It always outputs time sliced audio data.

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Audio Device In  receives audio from any of the attached audio input devices using DirectSound/CoreAudio or ASIO. It always outputs time sliced audio data. 
If you want to capture the data in memory, use a Trail CHOP or Record CHOP.	If you want to record to a file, use Audio File Out CHOP or Movie File Out TOP.	
The Audio Device In  can receive analog control voltages (CVs) as long as your audio device's analog to digital converters can handle constant non-zero voltages.
audiodeviceinCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  active - Turns the audio input on or off.


		
  driver -  - Select between default DirectSound/CoreAudio, ASIO, or native device supported drivers.

 default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer. datapath - Native support for capturing the audio from DataPath devices. blackmagic - Native support for capturing the audio from Blackmagic Design devices. aja - Native support for capturing the audio from AJA devices.
		
  device - A menu of available audio devices to receive input from. Selecting default sets the audio device to that which is selected in Windows >Sounds and Audio Devices>Audio>Sound Recording.



  errormissing - The  will error if the specified device is not found.



  inputs - When Driver is set to ASIO on Windows or CoreAudio on macOS, this parameter lets you pick which input channels to use.


		
  format -  - When Driver is set to DirectSound, this set mono, stereo, or multi-channel. Also determines how many channels are created 1(mono) or 2(stereo left and stereo right), or when set to multi-channel set the number of channels active on the Input 1 and Input 2 parameter pages.

 mono - Uses a single mono channel. stereo - USes 2 channels for stereo left and right. multichannel - Uses whichever channels are turned On on the Input 1 and Input 2 parameter pages.
		
  rate - Audio input sample rate expressed in samples per second.


		
  bufferlength - The size of the input buffer, will effect latency.  The larger the buffer the more latency is introduced.



  numchan - When using Driver Blackmagic or AJA, use this parameter to set the number of channels.





The toggles on this page are used when the Driver is set to DirectSound. The channels names are from legacy DirectSound terms, but can also be considered more simply chan1, chan2, chan3 and so on. For example, you can access the 7 microphone array from a Kinect Azure sensor using DirectSound and turning on the first 7 toggles here.

  frontleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  frontright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  frontcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  lowfrequency - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  backleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  backright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  frontleftcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  frontrightcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  backcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).





The toggles on this page are used when the Driver is set to DirectSound. The channels names are from legacy DirectSound terms, but can also be considered more simply chan1, chan2, chan3 and so on.

  sideleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  sideright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topfrontleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topfrontcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topfrontright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topbackleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topbackcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).


		
  topbackright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





Extra Information for the Audio Device In  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.


 - - - - -
 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



A custom interactive control panel built within TouchDesigner. Panels are created using Panel Components.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Audio_Device_In_CHOP&oldid=27106"
		Category: CHOPs

driver -  - Select between default DirectSound/CoreAudio, ASIO, or native device supported drivers.

 default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer. datapath - Native support for capturing the audio from DataPath devices. blackmagic - Native support for capturing the audio from Blackmagic Design devices. aja - Native support for capturing the audio from AJA devices.

parameters.name: DirectSound/CoreAudio
parameters.label: DirectSound/CoreAudio
parameters.description: default - The default Windows audio driver (a.k.a. WDM) or macOS CoreAudio driver, depending on your OS. asio - Low-latency drivers which usually come from the hardware's manufacturer. datapath - Native support for capturing the audio from DataPath devices. blackmagic - Native support for capturing the audio from Blackmagic Design devices. aja - Native support for capturing the audio from AJA devices.

parameters.name: Device
parameters.label: Device
parameters.description: device - A menu of available audio devices to receive input from. Selecting default sets the audio device to that which is selected in Windows >Sounds and Audio Devices>Audio>Sound Recording.

parameters.name: Error if Missing
parameters.label: Error if Missing
parameters.description: errormissing - The  will error if the specified device is not found.

parameters.name: Inputs
parameters.label: Inputs
parameters.description: inputs - When Driver is set to ASIO on Windows or CoreAudio on macOS, this parameter lets you pick which input channels to use.

parameters.name: Format
parameters.label: Format
parameters.description:
format -  - When Driver is set to DirectSound, this set mono, stereo, or multi-channel. Also determines how many channels are created 1(mono) or 2(stereo left and stereo right), or when set to multi-channel set the number of channels active on the Input 1 and Input 2 parameter pages.

 mono - Uses a single mono channel. stereo - USes 2 channels for stereo left and right. multichannel - Uses whichever channels are turned On on the Input 1 and Input 2 parameter pages.

parameters.name: Mono
parameters.label: Mono
parameters.description: mono - Uses a single mono channel. stereo - USes 2 channels for stereo left and right. multichannel - Uses whichever channels are turned On on the Input 1 and Input 2 parameter pages.

parameters.name: Rate
parameters.label: Rate
parameters.description: rate - Audio input sample rate expressed in samples per second.

parameters.name: Buffer Length
parameters.label: Buffer Length
parameters.description: bufferlength - The size of the input buffer, will effect latency.  The larger the buffer the more latency is introduced.

parameters.name: Number of Channels
parameters.label: Number of Channels
parameters.description: numchan - When using Driver Blackmagic or AJA, use this parameter to set the number of channels.

parameters.name: Front Left
parameters.label: Front Left
parameters.description: frontleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Front Right
parameters.label: Front Right
parameters.description: frontright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Front Center
parameters.label: Front Center
parameters.description: frontcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Low Frequency
parameters.label: Low Frequency
parameters.description: lowfrequency - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Back Left
parameters.label: Back Left
parameters.description: backleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Back Right
parameters.label: Back Right
parameters.description: backright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Front Left of Center
parameters.label: Front Left of Center
parameters.description: frontleftcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Front Right of Center
parameters.label: Front Right of Center
parameters.description: frontrightcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Back Center
parameters.label: Back Center
parameters.description: backcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Side Left
parameters.label: Side Left
parameters.description: sideleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Side Right
parameters.label: Side Right
parameters.description: sideright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Center
parameters.label: Top Center
parameters.description: topcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Front Left
parameters.label: Top Front Left
parameters.description: topfrontleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Front Center
parameters.label: Top Front Center
parameters.description: topfrontcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Front Right
parameters.label: Top Front Right
parameters.description: topfrontright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Back Left
parameters.label: Top Back Left
parameters.description: topbackleft - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Back Center
parameters.label: Top Back Center
parameters.description: topbackcenter - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Top Back Right
parameters.label: Top Back Right
parameters.description: topbackright - Enable this input if available (or simply adds another input channel).

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
